summary: The "Save America's Rural Hospitals Act" aims to improve healthcare access in rural areas. It proposes amendments to the Social Security Act focusing on enhanced payments for rural healthcare providers under Medicare and Medicaid. Key provisions address eliminating Medicare sequestration, reversing bad debt cuts, extending payment levels for certain hospitals, and implementing area wage index adjustments. It also includes measures for beneficiary copayments, regulatory relief, and grants to support rural health services and transformation.
